nbsObaMib.name: nbsObaMib
nbsObaMib.contactinfo: For technical support, please contact your service channel

nbsObaInfoGrp.name: nbsObaInfoGrp
nbsObaInfoGrp.description: For users to know if OBA is accessible

nbsObaAlsGrp.name: nbsObaAlsGrp
nbsObaAlsGrp.description: For users to configure the Automatic Laser Shut-down (ALS) feature

nbsObaInfoTable.name: nbsObaInfoTable
nbsObaInfoTable.description: Optical bandwidth allocation (OBA) definition(s); table entries are expected to be configured and viewed from the port-level.

nbsObaInfoLineIfIndex.name: nbsObaInfoLineIfIndex
nbsObaInfoLineIfIndex.description: The trunk or line port ifindex.

nbsObaInfoAvails.name: nbsObaInfoAvails
nbsObaInfoAvails.description: The comma separated list of bandwidth units available to the user

nbsObaInfoUnitSize.name: nbsObaInfoUnitSize
nbsObaInfoUnitSize.description: Shows the unit size in MHz

nbsObaInfoMaxUnits.name: nbsObaInfoMaxUnits
nbsObaInfoMaxUnits.description: Shows the maximum number of OBA units allowed on this port

nbsObaInfoMaxUnitsPerClientPort.name: nbsObaInfoMaxUnitsPerClientPort
nbsObaInfoMaxUnitsPerClientPort.description: Shows the maximum number of OBA units allowed on client ports

nbsObaDefineTableSize.name: nbsObaDefineTableSize
nbsObaDefineTableSize.description: The number of entries for the nbsObaDefineTable in this port

nbsObaDefineTable.name: nbsObaDefineTable
nbsObaDefineTable.description: Optical bandwidth allocation (OBA) definition(s); table entries are expected to be configured and viewed from the port-level.

nbsObaDefineLinePort.name: nbsObaDefineLinePort
nbsObaDefineLinePort.description: The line port (aka trunk port) associated with this entry.

nbsObaDefineOrdinalIndex.name: nbsObaDefineOrdinalIndex
nbsObaDefineOrdinalIndex.description: Ordinal index for this entry; arbitrarily picked, starting from 1. It is hidden from the CLI.

nbsObaDefineLabel.name: nbsObaDefineLabel
nbsObaDefineLabel.description: User defined label that uniquely identifies this OBA.

nbsObaDefineOduType.name: nbsObaDefineOduType
nbsObaDefineOduType.description: The information structure data unit (data rate): * ODU0 (1.24416 Gb/s)

nbsObaDefineOduList.name: nbsObaDefineOduList
nbsObaDefineOduList.description: A comma separated list of data unit identifiers assigned to this OBA; an identifier may be assigned to one OBA only. ODU0 identifiers are the letters a-h. The count of identifiers determines the maximum bandwidth available, based on nbsObaDefineOduType. Just enough should be assigned to convey the desired protocol; an overly generous assignment wastes a limited resource and reduces overall service capacity.

nbsObaDefineOduCount.name: nbsObaDefineOduCount
nbsObaDefineOduCount.description: The count of identifiers found in nbsObaDefineOduList.

nbsObaDefineMapType.name: nbsObaDefineMapType
nbsObaDefineMapType.description: Specifies the OBA traffic mapping type: * an express OBA passes from one line port to the other; * a standAlone OBA has no redundant backup; * a primary OBA is the first choice for redundant service; * a secondary OBA provides service when the primary OBA fails.

nbsObaDefineClientPort.name: nbsObaDefineClientPort
nbsObaDefineClientPort.description: The add/drop client port (aka user or access port) associated with this entry.

nbsObaDefineCoupledWith.name: nbsObaDefineCoupledWith
nbsObaDefineCoupledWith.description: This object's content depends on the 'nbsObaDefineMapType' value: * express -- the associated OBA on the other line port; * standAlone -- N/A * primary -- label of the associated secondary OBA; * secondary -- label of the associated primary OBA. Using an OBA's label instead of its ordinal index avoids unexpected and unintential associations after create/delete activities.

nbsObaDefineAllocationInfo.name: nbsObaDefineAllocationInfo
nbsObaDefineAllocationInfo.description: Indicates if the number of units (ODUs) exceed, are under, or match the port protocol specifications.

nbsObaDefineRowStatus.name: nbsObaDefineRowStatus
nbsObaDefineRowStatus.description: Used to create and delete OBAs

nbsObaAlsTable.name: nbsObaAlsTable
nbsObaAlsTable.description: The Automatic Laser Shutdown (ALS) setting for each port.

nbsObaAlsIfIndex.name: nbsObaAlsIfIndex
nbsObaAlsIfIndex.description: The ifindex associated with this entry.

nbsObaAlsState.name: nbsObaAlsState
nbsObaAlsState.description: Defines whether the Automatic Laser Shut-down (ALS) feature is enabled or disabled.
